SEARCH
Package com.app.numbers.utility.iteration

Interface NumberUtilityIteration

public interface NumberUtilityIteration
A utility interface providing various mathematical and array manipulation methods. All methods use iterative techniques for computation.

  • Method Summary

    Static Methods
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static long
    exponentiation(long x, int exponent)
    Calculates the result of raising a base number to a given exponent using exponentiation by squaring.

    Finds the maximum value in an array of integers.

    Finds the minimum value in an array of integers.

    Checks if a number is a perfect number.

    Checks if a number is a prime number.
    static double
    squareRoot(double number, double epsilon)
    Calculates the square root of a number using the iterative method of averaging.

  • Method Details

    • exponentiation

      static long exponentiation(long x, int exponent)
      Calculates the result of raising a base number to a given exponent using exponentiation by squaring.
      Parameters:
      x - The base number.
      exponent - The exponent to which the base number is raised. Must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      The result of x raised to the power of exponent.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the exponent is negative.

    • isPerfect

      static boolean isPerfect(long number)
      Checks if a number is a perfect number. A perfect number is a positive integer that is equal to the sum of its proper divisors.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to be checked. Must be greater than or equal to 6.
      Returns:
      true if number is a perfect number, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the number is less than 6.

    • isPrime

      static boolean isPrime(int number)
      Checks if a number is a prime number. A prime number is a positive integer greater than 1 that has no positive integer divisors other than 1 and itself.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to be checked. Must be a non-negative integer.
      Returns:
      true if number is a prime number, otherwise false.

    • squareRoot

      static double squareRoot(double number, double epsilon)
      Calculates the square root of a number using the iterative method of averaging.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to find the square root of. Must be positive.
      epsilon - The acceptable error margin for the result. Must be between 0 and 1 (exclusive).
      Returns:
      The approximate square root of number.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If number is less than or equal to 0, or epsilon is not in the range (0, 1).

    • getMax

      static int getMax(int[] numbers)
      Finds the maximum value in an array of integers.
      Parameters:
      numbers - The array of integers. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The maximum value found in the array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array is null or empty.

    • getMin

      static int getMin(int[] numbers)
      Finds the minimum value in an array of integers.
      Parameters:
      numbers - The array of integers. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The minimum value found in the array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array is null or empty.
